fsaToolTip: Portions of your remaining funds after you have made your benefit selections may be added to your Flexible Spending Account (FSA).
termsAndConditionsCopy:
Important notice: Please read these terms carefully before using this website. Use of this website by you indicates that you accept these terms. If you do not accept these terms, do not use this website

Access to this website is provided to you by your employer and is subject to these terms and conditions ("Terms"). Please read these Terms carefully before continuing to access the services described below. A USERID and Password will give you access via the Internet to (1) a database of member information ("Information") provided by Willis Towers Watson ("WTW", "we", "our" or "us") on behalf of the employer, (2) a facility which will enable you, where applicable, to update Information electronically, and (3) a facility which will enable you, where applicable, to initiate certain transactions electronically (together or individually referred to as the "Service").

  1. Provision of the Service
    1. Once you have accessed the Service using your USERID and password, you will be deemed to have accepted these Terms and these Terms will form a legally binding agreement. From that moment, you will then have the right to access the Information in accordance with these Terms until your right to use the Service is terminated.
    2. You are granted the right to use the Service and your USERID and password, solely in accordance with these Terms and any other instruction or direction for use supplied to you by us from time to time via the Service or otherwise.
    3. Technological changes from time to time may make the equipment which you use to access the Service (the "Equipment") obsolete or otherwise unsuitable. You are solely responsible for providing, updating, or replacing any part of the Equipment and for any telecommunication and other related costs. We make no warranty as to the suitability or otherwise of the Equipment, which is your responsibility alone. We reserve the right to change the Service at any time even if this causes you the need to update or replace the Equipment.
  2. Security and Personal Data
    1. You consent to the processing by WTW, by our associated companies and affiliates and by any third parties involved in the provision to you of the Service of the personal data submitted by you through the Service and/or created in the course of your relationship with us as administrators of your benefits scheme and to the transmission of such personal data to such associated companies and affiliates and/or third parties for purposes connected with employee or client administration. For further information, please see the Data Privacy Notice attached.
    2. At our sole discretion we may bar the use of your USERID and password from time to time due to security or other concerns or for general administration purposes. We will inform you as soon as reasonably possible of such action. You may then request a new USERID and password following the procedures advised by us.
    3. It is your responsibility to keep your USERID and password secret. In particular, you should not disclose your USERID or password to a third party or allow the Service to be accessed by a third party using your USERID and password.
    4. If you become aware of or suspect any unlawful or unauthorised use of your USERID and password you must immediately follow the procedure set out in clause 2.5 below and you should give us all relevant details you have in relation to any such use.
    5. If you become aware of or suspect any unlawful or unauthorised use of your USERID and password you should bring this to our attention by contacting us as soon as possible and you may then request a new USERID and password following the procedures advised by us.
    6. You will not be responsible for your USERID and password being used after you have notified us of the suspected unlawful or unauthorised use and requested that your USERID be cancelled.
  3. Your instructions
    1. You will be solely responsible for the use of your USERID and password. We will be entitled to treat any use of the Service as having been authorised by you where the Service is accessed using your USERID and password. This includes all instructions which are initiated or sent through the Service in conjunction with your USERID and password, whether in connection with any purchase, sale, switching, contribution, redirection, redemption or any other matter.
    2. If you have elected "view-only" access to the Service, the above provision regarding instructions will not apply and we will not act on any instructions initiated or sent through the Service without first seeking your written confirmation.
  4. Title
    1. We own the copyright and any other intellectual property rights subsisting anywhere in the world relating to the Service.
  5. Restrictions on Use
    1. You may not copy, reproduce, duplicate, modify, adopt or lend, sell or otherwise transfer, in whole or in part, any of the Information, except for the purpose of accessing the Service and producing print-outs for your own personal use.
  6. Limitations of Liability
    1. We make no warranty or representation that the Service will always be available or can be accessed at all times. The Service may be temporarily unavailable or restricted for administrative or other reasons. The Service may be temporarily or permanently suspended in the event of termination of the agreement between us, and/or your employer under which the Service is being provided to you. We do not accept any responsibility and will not be liable for any loss or damage as a result of negligence or otherwise, arising out of or in connection with any interruption, suspension or loss of use of the Service.
    2. You acknowledge that your uninterrupted access to the Service may also be prevented by certain factors outside our reasonable control (a "Service Disruption Event") including, without limitation, the in-operation, inefficiency or unsuitability of the Equipment and the unavailability, in-operation or interruption of Internet or other telecommunication services. Non-performance by us of our obligations under these Terms will not be a breach of these Terms where such non-performance results directly or indirectly from a Service Disruption Event. We do not accept any responsibility and will not be liable for any loss or damage arising out of or in connection with any such Service Disruption Event.
    3. We do not accept any responsibility and will not be liable for the inaccuracy or incompleteness of any data or information received by you or by us through the Service which arises out of or in connection with data transmission, machine or software error or malfunction or from your operating error or which originates from information obtained from third parties (other than such inaccuracy or incompleteness arising as a result of our negligence, fraud or wilful default).
    4. We do not represent or warrant that this website will be error-free, free of viruses or other impairing or harmful components.
    5. The content and any information available on or through this website is for information purposes only. We do not hold ourselves out as providing any actuarial, accounting, consulting, investment, legal, tax or any other type of professional advice. The accuracy, completeness, adequacy or currency of the content of and any information available on or through this website is not warranted or guaranteed. In particular, you acknowledge that we rely on the accuracy and completeness of prices and other information provided to us by third parties including fund managers. We expressly do not warrant that the calculations produced by any modelling and/or planners or other software tool as part of the Service will be accurate or that they can be used as the basis for the making of investment or pension planning decisions. By accepting these Terms you acknowledge and accept that any financial information contained in any such modelling and/or planners or other software tool is provided for illustrative purposes only and should not be relied upon as the basis of any decision to enter into any financial transaction and must not be used in place of professional financial advice.
    6. Whilst we will use our reasonable efforts to ensure that all transactions initiated by you via this website are processed as soon as possible, we shall have no liability to you in the event of any loss being suffered due to processing delays which are beyond our control.
    7. This website may contain links to other websites provided by independent third parties. We accordingly make no representations whatsoever concerning the content of those sites and the fact that we have provided a link to a particular site is not an endorsement, authorisation, sponsorship or affiliation by us with respect to such site, its owners or its providers.
    8. Except as expressly set out in these Terms, all other warranties and conditions, whether implied by statute, common law or otherwise (including but not limited to satisfactory quality and fitness for purpose), are hereby excluded to the extent permitted by law.
    9. We will not be liable if and to the extent that any losses, damages, cost or expenses suffered by you are due to the provision of false, inaccurate, misleading or incomplete information or documentation by you or any third party or due to the acts or omissions of any person other than us or any of our directors, officers or employees including without limitation the incorrect use of the Service by you or your failure to correctly input any data and/or information in connection with the Service.
    10. Our aggregate liability to you whether in contract, tort, breach of statutory duty or otherwise for any losses whatsoever and howsoever caused arising from or in any way connected with the Service or this website shall not exceed £5 million (including any claims for interest and costs).
    11. Nothing in this clause 6 shall exclude or restrict any liability of WTW for personal injury, death, fraud or dishonesty or otherwise to the extent that we cannot do so by law.
  7. Termination and Notice Provisions
    1. We may terminate your right to use the Service by giving notice in writing (whether electronically by means of the Service or otherwise) which will be effective immediately upon being sent, but this will not affect transactions already initiated.
    2. We reserve the right to amend these Terms from time to time. You will be notified of any such amendments.
  8. General Provisions
    1. If for any reason the Service becomes unavailable or inaccessible for an extended period of time, you may initiate transactions or give instructions by contacting us by fax, telephone or email.
    2. Failure or delay to enforce any right under these Terms will not be construed as an implied waiver of the same or of any other right in the future.
    3. All of the terms and conditions relating to the Service are contained in these Terms and any other instruction or direction for use supplied to you by us. No oral communications that you may have with us shall override, supersede, vary or in any way alter these Terms or any part thereof unless we confirm them to you in writing.
    4. If any provision in these Terms is held or made invalid by any competent court, statute, rule or otherwise, the remainder of these Terms will not be affected.
    5. These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of England and Wales.
    6. The Courts of England will have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any claim or matter arising under or in relation to these Terms.

Privacy Notice for Employees and Administrators

Please read this Privacy Notice carefully. It describes how Willis Towers Watson ("WTW") handles personal information about You which WTW collects in connection with the operation of BenefitsMarketplace. It also explains certain legal rights You have in connection with Your personal information which is handled by WTW.

  1. What is the purpose of this Privacy Notice, and does it apply to me?
    1. The purpose of this Privacy Notice is to inform You about how WTW handles Your personal information which WTW obtains in connection with the operation of BenefitsMarketplace, an online employee benefits administration platform made available as part of the services WTW provides to WTW's corporate clients.
    2. This Privacy Notice will apply to You if You are an individual member (or an administrator) of an employee benefits scheme which is arranged by WTW on behalf of WTW's corporate client, and administered through BenefitsMarketplace.
    3. Nothing in this Privacy Notice alters any existing relationship between You and WTW, or creates any new relationship between You and WTW. Nothing in this Privacy Notice affects any right You have under any applicable law which regulates the way in which WTW handles Your personal information.
  2. What Personal Information about me does WTW collect?
    1. The type and amount of personal information about You which WTW collects will vary depending on various factors, including Your personal circumstances and the relevant services provided by WTW, but may include any combination of the following:
      1. Your contact details such as name, postal address, email address, and telephone number;
      2. Your gender, date/place of birth, marital status, nationality, country of residence, occupation, hobbies, habits, and other similar demographic information;
      3. Your unique identifiers such as bank account number, passport number, and employee number;
      4. Information about Your finances, such as details of Your income and existing pension/insurance arrangements and amounts insured/claimed;
      5. Information about Your physical and mental health, including Your medical history, description of illness or injury suffered, and any specific treatment received;
      6. Information about You which WTW is obliged to check for legal or regulatory reasons, such as information relating to Your identity and Your criminal history (including allegations of crimes);
      7. Other information about You which WTW handles in connection with the services WTW provides through BenefitsMarketplace, such as details of incidents giving rise to any insurance claim submitted by You or on Your behalf through BenefitsMarketplace, and information about Your access to and use of BenefitNet (including IP address from which You access BenefitsMarketplace, and cookies placed on Your computer to enable You to log into BenefitsMarketplace); and
      8. Any of the foregoing categories of information that relate to Your dependents.
    2. Please note that personal information which WTW collects through BenefitsMarketplace may include sensitive information such as Your racial/ethnic origin, sex life, criminal record, and health.
    3. WTW will collect Your personal information only if and to the extent it is necessary for one or more of the purposes described in Section 4 below.
  3. Why does WTW collect my Personal Information?
    1. WTW collects and uses Your personal information primarily for the purpose of WTW and its affiliates providing employee benefits-related services which is arranged for Your benefit such as where WTW is acting as the Insurance Broker for any insurance benefits or where WTW is acting as an administrator where Your employer asks WTW and its affiliates to arrange/administer health plan, pension plan, or other forms of employee benefits).
    2. WTW and its affiliates also collect and use Your personal information for the following related purposes:
      1. to enable underwriters, actuaries, insurers, reinsurers, pension providers, claims handlers, insurance brokers (where WTW is not the Insurance Broker for the insurance benefits), banks and other lenders, health professionals, lawyers, accountants, auditors, consultants, and other like third party professional advisors and service providers to provide their services (to the extent their involvement is inherent in or necessary in connection with the services provided by WTW and its affiliates);
      2. to enable subsidiaries, affiliates and related companies of Willis Towers Watson PLC and non-affiliated services providers (such as IT services providers and administrative support service providers) to provide services that directly or indirectly support WTW's business operation and the services provided by WTW (including the maintenance and support of BenefitsMarketplace);
      3. to comply with legal or regulatory requirements imposed on WTW or a client of WTW (including the requirement to conduct 'Know-Your-Client' checks, anti-money laundering/sanctions screening, and other like due diligence checks);
      4. to improve or develop the products and services WTW provides to its clients in general (e.g. improving internal business processes, providing analysis on trends in the employee benefits market, benchmarking employee benefits products, devising ways to simplify/streamline the insurance placement/administration process or claims handling process, designing new types of benefits products, etc.); and
      5. to contact You and generally maintain the relationship between You and WTW in connection with the services provided by WTW and its affiliates to You, and to keep You informed about the products and services offered by WTW and subsidiaries, affiliates and related companies of Willis Towers Watson PLC which might be of interest or benefit to You.
    3. For the purpose of improving or developing WTW's products and services (see Section 4.2.4 above), WTW may use Your personal information to create and analyse statistical data, and the outcome of such analysis might be shared with third parties. However, such analysis will be conducted solely on an aggregated and anonymous basis and under no circumstance will any specific personal information relating to You or any information from which You could be identified be included in such analysis.
    4. Your personal information will be used for marketing purpose (see Section 4.2.5 above) only if You are Yourself a client of WTW or if You are the business contact at a client of WTW (e.g. You are a Finance Director, HR Manager, or Risk Manager and You are involved in making insurance purchasing/administration decisions). For further information regarding WTW's direct marketing practice, please refer to Section 7 below.
    5. Please note that WTW will never use Your personal information for any purpose not described above without Your prior consent (or the prior consent of the relevant client of WTW).
  4. How does WTW obtain my Personal Information?
    1. Where WTW is required to handle Your personal information in connection with the operation of BenefitsMarketplace, WTW generally obtains Your personal information indirectly from a client of WTW or its affiliates which receives services that affect You such as where WTW is acting as the Insurance Broker for any insurance benefits and an affiliate of WTW acting as an administrator is asked by its client to arrange/administer health plan, pension plan, and other employee benefits for employees of that client).
    2. Additionally, where You directly access BenefitsMarketplace, WTW will also obtain Your personal information directly from You. This could be the case, for example, where You submit an insurance claim through BenefitsMarketplace or update Your personal details through BenefitsMarketplace.
    3. Depending on the circumstances, WTW and its affiliates may also obtain Your personal information from other sources such as:
      1. providers of identity verification services, providers of insurance claims validation services, operators of insurance fraud and other business risk screening databases, and other like providers of due diligence services; and
      2. underwriters, actuaries, insurers, reinsurers, pension providers, claims handlers, insurance brokers (where WTW is not the Insurance Broker for the insurance benefits), banks and other lenders, health professionals, lawyers, accountants, auditors, consultants, and other like third party professional advisors and service providers who interact with WTW in connection with the services WTW provides.
  5. Do I have to give my Personal Information to WTW or allow WTW to handle my Personal Information?
    1. It is not mandatory for You to provide any personal information which WTW asks You to provide nor is it mandatory for You to consent to WTW handling Your personal information in any particular way. You can also at any time revoke any consent You give in respect of the processing of Your personal information by WTW if You change Your mind.
    2. However, if You:
      1. refuse to provide Your personal information which WTW and its affiliates requests;
      2. do not consent to WTW and its affiliates handling Your personal information in accordance with this Privacy Notice; or
      3. revoke any consent regarding the handling of Your personal information by WTW and its affiliates You have previously given,
      then such refusal or revocation of previously given consent might prevent WTW and its affiliates from performing their services, and this might in turn, depending on Your circumstances, adversely affect You (e.g. through delays in effecting of insurance or assessment/payment of insurance claims).
    3. If You consent to the collection and processing of Your personal information by WTW and its affiliates but later revoke Your consent, WTW will endeavour to comply with Your request but there may be circumstances where WTW will not be able to comply with Your request (e.g. if You revoke Your consent to the disclosure of Your personal information to third parties, WTW will not be able to 'undo' a disclosure that has already taken place).
    4. Additionally, where there is a relevant legal exemption (or where there is no relevant law) that applies to the way in which WTW handles Your personal information, WTW reserves the right to rely on such legal exemption (or the absence of relevant law) to collect and process Your personal information regardless of Your wishes but only if and to the extent it is necessary to do so for one or more of the purposes described in Section 4 above (e.g. where WTW is required by law to validate Your identity for fraud prevention purpose or compelled by law to disclose Your personal information to regulators or law enforcement agencies, or where WTW would otherwise be prevented from providing the services as requested by WTW's client).
  6. Does WTW use my Personal Information for Marketing?
    1. WTW does not engage in direct marketing activities that target consumers in general, but if You are Yourself a past or current client of WTW, or if You are a business contact at a past or current client of WTW, You might from time to time receive marketing communications from WTW, e.g. information regarding a new product or service offered by WTW, or invitation to a seminar or conference hosted by WTW which might be of interest to You (see Section 4.4 above).
    2. Where WTW does send any marketing communication to You, WTW will ensure that such marketing communications are sent in compliance with the applicable laws, and in particular, ensure that there is an easy way for You to stop receiving (i.e. "opt-out" from) such marketing communications in the future.
    3. Please be assured that if You interact with WTW solely as an individual member of an employee benefits scheme arranged by WTW for WTW's client, Your personal information will never be used by WTW for any direct marketing exercise.
    4. WTW will never sell, rent, or otherwise share Your personal information with operators of marketing databases or other non-affiliated third parties for their own marketing purposes. For further clarification regarding how WTW shares Your personal information with third parties, please see Section 8 below.
  7. Does WTW share my Personal Information with third parties?
    1. WTW and its affiliates will share Your personal information with third parties only if and to the extent it is necessary and appropriate for one or more of the purposes set out in Section 4 above. Specifically, WTW and its affiliates may share Your personal information with the following types of third parties:
      1. underwriters, actuaries, insurers, reinsurers, pension providers, claims handlers, insurance brokers (where WTW is not the Insurance Broker for the insurance benefits), banks and other lenders, health professionals, lawyers, accountants, auditors, consultants, and other like third party professional advisors and service providers who interact with WTW and its affiliates in connection with the services WTW and its affiliates provides (to the extent their involvement is inherent in or necessary in connection with any of the services provided by WTW and its affiliates);
      2. subsidiaries, affiliates and related companies of Willis Towers Watson PLC and non-affiliated services providers (such as IT services providers and administrative support service providers) to provide services that directly or indirectly support WTW's business operation and the services provided by WTW (including the maintenance and support of BenefitsMarketplace);
      3. providers of identity verification services, providers of insurance claims validation services, operators of insurance fraud and other business risk screening databases, and other like providers of due diligence services (to the extent necessary to comply with legal or regulatory requirements imposed on WTW or a client of WTW); and
      4. regulators, police, courts/tribunals, and other like public authorities who have jurisdiction over WTW (to the extent necessary to comply with any legal or regulatory requirements imposed on WTW or a client of WTW).
    2. Please note that where WTW shares Your personal information with regulators, police, courts/tribunals, and other like public authorities, WTW may, depending on the circumstances, be forbidden from advising You (or the relevant client of WTW) of the fact that Your personal information was disclosed to or requested by such third parties.
    3. In all other cases, WTW will not share Your personal information with other third parties without Your prior consent (or the prior consent of the relevant client of WTW, where applicable) unless WTW has a legal ground on which to do so (e.g. where any applicable law requires WTW to do so, or where WTW is compelled to do so by a court order).
  8. Does WTW transfer my Personal Information overseas?
    1. Due to the global nature of WTW's business operation, and the complex and international nature of employee benefits business, WTW may need to transfer Your personal information across international borders to destinations where the law governing the protection of Your personal information may differ from the relevant law (if any) that applies in Your country.
    2. Your personal information may be transferred across international borders by WTW to subsidiaries, affiliates and related companies of Willis Towers Watson PLC and non-affiliated third parties described in Section 8.1 above, who could be located anywhere in the world. As a minimum, such third party recipients based overseas will include:
      1. subsidiaries, affiliates and related companies of Willis Towers Watson PLC that are based in the UK, elsewhere in the EEA, USA, China, the Philippines and India who provide IT systems support and administrative/operational support to WTW.
    3. Please note that where WTW shares Your personal information with subsidiaries, affiliates and related companies of Willis Towers Watson PLC or any other third party located overseas, Your personal information will be shared only to the extent it is necessary to allow such overseas recipients to perform their relevant task.
    4. Whenever WTW transfers Your personal information across international borders, WTW will take all appropriate steps that are within WTW's control to take so as to ensure that such transfer complies with the applicable legal requirements.
  9. How will my Personal Information be kept by WTW?
    1. Personal information WTW obtains through BenefitsMarketplace will be entered into the relevant parts of the IT systems used by WTW. Such IT systems (including BenefitsMarketplace itself) are operated and supported by affiliates of WTW as well as non-affiliated service providers outside of the local territory. Such personal information will usually be held only in electronic form, although WTW might occasionally keep such personal information in paper form. (e.g. print-out of claim forms, letters, etc. for inclusion in files kept by WTW's brokers and advisors)
    2. Whether it exists in electronic form or paper form, Your personal information will be retained by WTW for as long as they are required for one or more of the purposes specified in Section 4. Please note that for legal and regulatory reasons, WTW will often need to retain Your personal information even after WTW stops performing the relevant services which requires WTW to handle Your personal information.
    3. Please be assured that WTW treats information security very seriously. Regardless of how Your personal information is kept, the privacy and confidentiality of Your personal information under WTW's control will be protected in accordance with the strict standards set by Willis Towers Watson PLC Information Security Policy which applies to Willis Towers Watson PLC and is enforced by a dedicated team of experienced security experts.
    4. Encryption, anti-malware, firewalls, back-up/disaster recovery systems, restriction of access to premises/IT systems, careful selection of personnel as well as relevant third party service providers, and other technical and organizational measures as appropriate will be used to prevent and detect unauthorized or accidental access, loss, disclosure, or other like incident that might affect Your personal information, regardless of whether Your personal data is held physically or electronically.
    5. In the unlikely and unfortunate event Your personal information under WTW's control becomes compromised due to any information security breach (e.g. unauthorised access, loss, or disclosure/alteration, including where this is caused by contractors), WTW will act promptly to identify the cause of such information security breach, and remediate and mitigate the consequences of such information security breach. Where appropriate, WTW will also notify You (and/or the relevant client of WTW, where applicable) in accordance with any applicable law which requires WTW to notify You about such incidents.
  10. Does WTW monitor my use of BenefitsMarketplace in any way?
    1. WTW has the capability to monitor the access to and the use of BenefitsMarketplace by its staff and clients in general. WTW may make use of such monitoring capability to monitor Your access to and use of BenefitsMarketplace where this is considered necessary in order to protect the reputation, assets, and confidential/personal information of WTW and WTW's clients. Such monitoring forms part of the information security measures deployed by WTW (as described in Section 10 above).
  11. Will this Privacy Notice change in the future?
    1. This Privacy Notice may be amended from time to time to reflect changes in law or changes in WTW's business operation, but where such revision becomes necessary in the future, WTW will notify You to the extent it is practicable for WTW to do so. WTW will always notify its corporate clients about any changes to this Privacy Notice.
    2. Changes to this Privacy Notice will be publicised and accessible on WTW's BenefitsMarketplace portal.
  12. Who can I contact about my Personal Information held on BenefitsMarketplace?
    1. If You have any question or concern regarding the way in which Your personal information is handled by WTW through BenefitsMarketplace, please contact:

Office of the General Counsel
Willis Towers Watson
71 High Holborn
London WC1V 6TP

To help us identify you, please let us know your full name and full name of the company that provides you with access to BenefitsMarketplace when you contact us. In most cases, we would need to verify your identify before providing you with more information relating to your personal information.

10th October 2016
myFamilyDependentInfo: Please be aware that the dependents you have added to this site may not be eligible for coverage for all benefits.  You should check the individual benefits to make sure that you have a full understanding of the dependent coverage provided.
securityModelDescription: Willis Towers Watson are committed to protecting the security of your personal information.  Willis Towers Watson's site uses bank-level encryption and European Union security standards.  Willis Towers Watson's colleague code of conduct ensures the security of your personal information is taken seriously.  Willis Towers Watson regularly reviews its operations and business practices so your personal information stays secure.  Willis Towers Watson also use Thwate, an independent software company, to provide an encrypted link between its web server and your browser
browserSupportDescription:
This site works best using the following browsers:

  • Chrome 28 (or higher)
  • Mozilla Firefox 29 (or higher)
  • Safari 5.1 (or higher)
  • Opera 15 (or higher)
  • Internet Explorer 9.0 (or higher)
  • UC Browser 9.7 (or higher)

If you are using an earlier version, please upgrade

If you're using a smartphone or a tablet, our site is completely mobile-friendly, giving you the best experience on any device
reviewDependentDescription: Please confirm the level of benefit coverage for this dependent. (The cost below is the cost to you).
viewBeneficiariesDescription:
You need to choose a beneficiary for each of your benefits below. A beneficiary is an individual or organisation who will receive any benefit pay-outs should the worst happen.

You can name up to six beneficiaries per benefit. If you choose more than one beneficiary you will need to assign a percentage of the potential pay-out to each beneficiary. The total must be 100%.

If you have any questions about who can qualify as a beneficiary, please see Glossary .
primaryBeneficiaryCopy: You need to choose a beneficiary for this benefit.  You can name up to six beneficiaries. If you name more than one you will need to assign a percentage of the potential pay-out to each. The total must be 100%.
contingentBeneficiaryCopy: You need to choose a beneficiary for this benefit.  You can name up to six beneficiaries. If you name more than one you will need to assign a percentage of the potential pay-out to each. The total must be 100%.
beneficiaryLegalCopy: By selecting the checkbox below, you agree to the terms and conditions associated with your benefits
privacyAndSecurityCopy: Your beneficiary information is secure within the system: we, as your employer, can access it; and it is only shared with insurance companies who need it to process your dependent coverage
passwordMinSecurityReqs: Your new password does not meet security requirements - try again
passwordRuleMinimumChars: Must have at least eight characters
passwordRuleMinNumber: Must contain at least one number
passwordRuleMinUpperAndLowerChar: Must contain at least one upper and one lower case character
passwordRuleMinSymbolChar: Must contain at least one special character (such as !,#,%,@)
passwordRulesHeader: Here are some tips on setting your new password
passwordsDontMatch: These passwords don't seem to match up - try again
passwordsTooShort: Passwords must be at least six characters long
challengeQuestionsHeader: The challenge questions will help protect your account
challengeEasyToRemember: Choose a question with an answer that's easy to remember
challengeMinimum2Characters: This needs to have a minimum of two characters
challengeLettersNumbersSpecialsAllowed: Letters, numbers, special characters (such as, $,#,@,*) are allowed
challengeQAReUseNotAllowed: You cannot re-use the same questions and answers
challengeQTooShort: Your challenge question must contain at least two characters (either letters or numbers)
challengeATooShort: Your challenge answers must contain at least two characters (either letters or numbers)
challengeQuestionCanceled: Are you sure you want to cancel? You have not saved your challenge questions
allFieldsRequired: You need to complete all fields
incorrectPassword: Enter your current password in the old password field
passwordRuleMismatch: You need to create a password that meets the security standards! Try again
welcomeToBenefits: Welcome To Your Personalized Benefits Portal.
whyAmIHereContent: Your employer has selected several benefits as part of your total compensation package.  This website allows you to review your existing benefits, access resources to help you manage those benefits, and add dependents or beneficiaries to selected plans.
howMuchDoIPayContent: Your employer is contributing to your benefits and your out-of-pocket cost (if any) will appear on the following pages. You will also have the chance to add dependent coverage, so be sure to take into account any benefits you may have outside of the system - such as a spouse or partner's medical plan - when making your elections. Remember, this may incur out-of-pocket costs for any additional coverage.
contactUsContent: For benefits or technical questions, please contact us.
helpCenterContent: For information about selecting your benefits, please visit the Education Center.
beneficiarySaveFailure: Your beneficiary information has not been saved - try again
maxBeneficiaryRedirectMessage: You can only have six beneficiaries - please revise your selections
beneficiaryAllocationSaveError: Beneficiary allocations not saved - try again
dependentSaveError: Sorry, something went wrong - try again.
contactInfoSavedError: Contact Information Not Saved - Try Again
phoneNumberRemovedSuccess: Your phone number has been removed.
phoneNumberRemovedFailure: There was a problem removing your phone number - try again.
lifeEventDescription: There are some benefits you can choose or change if you have a 'life event' - a major change to your personal circumstances.  You only have a limited time to tell us about each Life Event - please look under 'More Information' to see what those time limiits are.  Select a life event from the dropdown to get started

1. I intend to submit this request for consideration and verify that the information I've provided is accurate.
  2. I understand that requests processed are legally binding and that elections I've made can't be changed during the plan year, unless I experience a qualifying life event
  3. I acknowledge that I am responsible for notifying my employer of any change in my status within the specified time limit. Failing to provide notification may result in losing my right to make changes and/or disqualifying me and my dependents from coverage.
  4. I authorize my employer to reduce my wages to pay for my elections and to deduct any missed premiums from my future pay to prevent lapses in coverage. If my employer pays all premiums, I understand that this provision may not apply.

Below is a list of your benefits and beneficiary elections. A beneficiary is an individual or organization that will receive any benefit payout in the event you are not able to. If you have any questions about who can qualify as a beneficiary, please refer to the Glossary section or contact us.

If any of your Primary beneficiaries are unable to receive shares, you can name a back-up, or Secondary beneficiary. Please specify who should receive this benefit and be sure that your total is 100%.

privacyPolicyDescription:
Introduction

This Data Privacy Notice is provided by Willis Towers Watson in connection with the Health and Group Benefit Plans that we administer on behalf of employers. The Notice is intended to inform you about how Willis Towers Watson collects and processes personal data in connection with those Plans, and about your data privacy rights in relation to the data that is collected and held about you or your dependents.

Data Collection and Use

The personal data that Willis Towers Watson collects and processes from you and/or your employer in relation to its Health and Group Benefit Plans is limited to that which is relevant and/or required for the services that we provide, as well as by the written agreement in place with your employer. Generally, the data elements that are collected may include some of the following: names of client employees and their dependents; addresses, email address, dates of birth, health plan enrollment information, marital status, union status, compensation information, disability information (if applicable), gender, Social Security or Social Insurance numbers, nationality, and health insurance coverage information.

In relation to the collection and processing of sensitive personal data (such as that relating to race, ethnicity, etc...), Willis Towers Watson collects and processes only that data which is necessary and relevant to the processing requirement, and not any additional information.

The information that we collect is used to establish and maintain your enrollment in the Health and Group Benefit Accounts, facilitate any payments or payouts in relation to those accounts, and comply with legal and administrative obligations. Willis Towers Watson does not use the data for any unrelated purpose.

Access and Sharing

Willis Towers Watson limits access to your data within our organization and by any third parties to individuals whose job responsibilities require access. Third party partners who are entrusted with personal data in relation to our Health and Group Benefit Plans are required to provide written assurances in advance of any access, confirming that they will uphold a substantially equivalent level of protection for your data. Willis Towers Watson does not permit third parties or anyone else to use your data for a purpose unrelated to our Health and Group Benefits plan administration services on behalf of your employer.

Data Security

Willis Towers Watson has put in place technical and organizational safeguards that are, at a minimum, consistent with its legal obligations and designed to protect your data from loss, misuse, alteration, destruction or unauthorized access. Those safeguards are updated as the legal requirements and security threats evolve, in order to best ensure that your data continues to be appropriately safeguarded.

Data Transfers

Willis Towers Watson is a global professional services organization and administers Health and Group Benefit Plans on behalf of organizations around the globe. As such, it is possible that your data may be transferred, processed or stored outside of your country of residence. While the privacy laws and requirements may differ from place to place,Willis Towers Watson nevertheless takes steps to ensure that your data is protected in a manner consistent with the privacy laws of your country and that applicable data transfer requirements are appropriately fulfilled.

Data Retention

Willis Towers Watson retains personal data of Health and Group Benefit Plan Participants and their dependents in accordance with business and legal requirements. Thereafter, the data will be returned to your employer or securely destroyed.

Accuracy of the Data

Willis Towers Watson takes steps to ensure that the information that we collect, process and hold about Health and Group Benefit Participants and their dependents is accurate and complete. We accordingly ask that you notify us promptly should any of your information change or require updating (e.g., address, contact details, dependents). We also rely on your employer to keep us informed about any of these changes that Plan Participants convey to them.

Questions or Concerns

You have the right to contact your employer or Willis Towers Watson to ask questions about your data, or to request access, amendment, correction or withdrawal from the Health and Group Benefit Plans. Those rights are upheld in a manner consistent with applicable laws and regulator expectations. Should you have a question for Willis Towers Watson about your data, please email us at WTW.Benefits.Marketplace.Support@willistowerswatson.com.

2016-2017 version.

Important note: Your costs reflect the full level of cover you selected.  However, until this is approved or denied, your payroll deduction will reflect costs for the default limit.
bmMyStoreNewHireEligibilityNotMet: You are ineligible for this product as a new hire.
advPelcText: Excess personal liability coverage protects your assets and future earnings in the event that you or your family are held legally liable for an accident involving bodily injury or property damage, or if you are sued for personal injury.
advPelcModalText: Excess personal liability, or umbrella, coverage protects your assets and future earnings in the event that you or your family are held legally liable for an accident involving bodily injury or property damage, or if you are sued for personal injury. This coverage can be much more cost effective and convenient to purchase through a group program than if it is purchased individually. We recommend purchasing a limit that protects your total personal assets. You should consider purchasing additional coverage if you have higher liability risk-factors, such as youthful drivers in your household, recreational vehicles, watercraft, swimming pools, hot tubs, trampolines, multiple homes and autos, tenant-occupied homes, higher-risk dog breeds, and horses.
